p: The viability of infected Caco-2 cells was assessed with trypan blue, which stains dead cells but is actively excluded from viable eukaryotic cells. The test demonstrated a dramatic CPE reduction in L. monocytogenes strains grown in presence of 256 Î¼g/mL of the C. sativa EO (Figure 6), in particular, the monolayers infected with the extract-exposed strains were actually indistinguishable from the uninfected monolayers, whereas the CPE of control monolayers, i.e., those infected with strains grown without the EO, took the form of large, almost contiguous, stained areas.
